alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:37PM EST until January 30 at 5:48AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Cass River At Frankenmuth affecting Saginaw County. For the Cass River...including Cass City, Vassar, Frankenmuth... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cass River at Frankenmuth. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Sunday the stage was 18.6 feet and slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, The river begins to overflow its banks in places, flooding adjacent low lands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1030 AM EST.
